member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewClipboardCutMode.EnableWithoutHeaderText
member.summary: The text values of selected cells can be cut and copied to the Clipboard. Header text is not included.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewClipboardCutMode.EnableAlwaysIncludeHeaderText
member.summary: The text values of selected cells can be cut and copied to the Clipboard. Header text is included for rows and columns that contain selected cells.

member.summary: Copying to the Clipboard is disabled.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewClipboardCopyMode.EnableWithoutHeaderText
member.summary: The text values of selected cells can be copied to the Clipboard. Header text is not included.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewClipboardCopyMode.EnableAlwaysIncludeHeaderText
member.summary: The text values of selected cells can be copied to the Clipboard. Header text is included for rows and columns that contain selected cells.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts
member.summary: Represents the state of a data-bound control when a data error occurred.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.ClipboardContent
member.summary: A data error occurred when copying content to the Clipboard. This value indicates that the cell value could not be converted to a string.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.Commit
member.summary: A data error occurred when committing changes to the data store. This value indicates that data entered in a cell could not be committed to the underlying data store.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.CurrentCellChange
member.summary: A data error occurred when the selection cursor moved to another cell. This value indicates that a user selected a cell when the previously selected cell had an error condition.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.Display
member.summary: A data error occurred when displaying a cell that was populated by a data source. This value indicates that the value from the data source cannot be displayed by the cell, or a mapping that translates the value from the data source to the cell is missing.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.Formatting
member.summary: A data error occurred when trying to format data that is either being sent to a data store, or being loaded from a data store. This value indicates that a change to a cell failed to format correctly. Either the new cell value needs to be corrected or the cell's formatting needs to change.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.InitialValueRestoration
member.summary: A data error occurred when restoring a cell to its previous value. This value indicates that a cell tried to cancel an edit and the rollback to the initial value failed. This can occur if the cell formatting changed so that it is incompatible with the initial value.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.LeaveControl
member.summary: A data error occurred when the lost focus. This value indicates that the could not commit user changes after losing focus.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.Parsing
member.summary: A data error occurred when parsing new data. This value indicates that the could not parse new data that was entered by the user or loaded from the underlying data store.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.PreferredSize
member.summary: A data error occurred when calculating the preferred size of a cell. This value indicates that the failed to calculate the preferred width or height of a cell when programmatically resizing a column or row. This can occur if the cell failed to format its value.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.RowDeletion
member.summary: A data error occurred when deleting a row. This value indicates that the underlying data store threw an exception when a data-bound deleted a row.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridViewDataErrorContexts.Scroll
member.summary: A data error occurred when scrolling a new region into view. This value indicates that a cell with data errors scrolled into view programmatically or with the scroll bar.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction
member.summary: Predefined filter expression enumeration. Used by class.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.NoFilter
member.summary: No filter would be applied, filter controls would be cleared

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.Contains
member.summary: Same as: FieldName LIKE '%value%'

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.DoesNotContain
member.summary: Same as: FieldName NOT LIKE '%value%'

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.StartsWith
member.summary: Same as: FieldName LIKE 'value%'

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.EndsWith
member.summary: Same as: FieldName LIKE '%value'

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.EqualTo
member.summary: Same as: FieldName = value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.NotEqualTo
member.summary: Same as: FieldName != value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.GreaterThan
member.summary: Same as: FieldName > value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.LessThan
member.summary: Same as: FieldName < value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.GreaterThanOrEqualTo
member.summary: Same as: FieldName >= value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.LessThanOrEqualTo
member.summary: Same as: FieldName <= value

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.Between
member.summary:
Same as: value1 <= FieldName <= value2.
Note that value1 and value2 should be separated by [space] when entered as filter.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.NotBetween
member.summary:
Same as: FieldName <= value1 && FieldName >= value2.
Note that value1 and value2 should be separated by [space] when entered as filter.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.IsEmpty
member.summary: Same as: FieldName = ''

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.NotIsEmpty
member.summary: Same as: FieldName != ''

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridKnownFunction.IsNull
member.summary: Only null values

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByExpression
member.summary: Expression similar to SQL's "Select Group By" clause that is used by GridTableView to group items . Expressions can be defined by assigning Expression property and/or managing the items in or collections.
member.remarks: If you use property to assign group by expression as string then the expression is parsed and and are created. If the expression syntax is incorrect a would be thrown. You can use 's properties to set expression's fields appearance format strings, etc. See property for details about the expression syntax.

member.remarks:

Column's data-format-string depending on the type of the column. For example
will be copied to .
Column's will be copied to
member.param: the column (and its FieldName respectively) that will be used for grouping RadGridView

member.summary: Gets or Sets the format string that is applied to group expressions that have no explicitly specified format string.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByExpression.SelectFields
member.summary: Gets a collection of SelectField objects (field names, aggregates etc.) that form the "Select" clause. Standing on the left side of the "Group By" clause.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByExpression.GroupByFields
member.summary: Gets a collection of objects that form the grouping clause. Standing on the right side of the "Group By" clause

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByExpression.Expression
member.summary: String representation of the GroupBy expression. See Remarks for details.

remarks.para:
Create group-by expressions, using the following expression syntax:
fieldname[ as alias] [format "..."]|aggregate(fieldname|alias)[as alias][, ...] Group By fieldname|alias [ASC|DESC]
Where:
fieldname: name of any field from the DataSource
alias: alias string. This cannot contain blanks or other reserved symbols like ',', '.' etc.
aggregate: any of - min, max, sum, count, last, first etc (the same as in GridAggregateFunction enumeration)
formatstring identical to the one used with string.Format, where the first argument is the field name or the alias and the second one is the actual value. The default value is "{0}: {1}"
Example: Country, City, count(Country) Items, ContactName Group By Country, City desc

example.code: Country, City, count(Country) Items, ContactName Group By Country, City desc
Country, City, count(Country) Items, ContactName Group By Country, City desc

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByField.Aggregate
member.remarks: Meaningful only for fields in the collection.
member.summary: Gets or sets aggregate function (from enumeration values) that will be applied on the grouped data.
member.value: Returns the result from currently used aggregate function. This property defaults to GridAggregateFunction.None

example.code:
Dim gridGroupByField As GridGroupByField
gridGroupByField = New GridGroupByField gridGroupByField.FieldName = "Freight" gridGroupByField.HeaderText = "Total shipping cost is " gridGroupByField.Aggregate = GridAggregateFunction.Sum expression.SelectFields.Add(gridGroupByField)

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByField.HeaderText
member.remarks: Meaningful only for fields in the collection. When rendering RadGrid will override the FieldAlias value with the HeaderText specified.
member.value: string, copied from the column's HeaderText if this group expression is based on a column. It defaults to the FieldAlias value (if specified).
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression that will be displayed in the .

example.code:
Dim gridGroupByField As GridGroupByField
gridGroupByField = New GridGroupByField gridGroupByField.FieldName = "EmployeeID" gridGroupByField.HeaderText = "EmployeeNo" expression.SelectFields.Add(gridGroupByField)

member.summary: Gets or sets the data type of the field.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.GridGroupByField.FieldAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing a friendly name for the field used for forming the group by expression. This name will be displayed in each group header when grouping by the respective field.

remarks.para: Use this property for setting the field text that will be displayed in the GridGroupHeaderItem. If this property is not set, the value of property will be used. Note that this property has a meaning only for GridGroupByField part of the SelectFields of GridGroupByExpression.
This property is useful in cases when:

list.item:
you want to change the value displayed in group header (different than the default FieldName column value)
or
group by a template column and RadGridView cannot get the header text for that column.

example.code:
Dim gridGroupByField As GridGroupByField
'Add select fields (before the "Group By" clause) gridGroupByField = New GridGroupByField gridGroupByField.FieldName = "EmployeeID" gridGroupByField.FieldAlias = "EmployeeIdentificator" expression.SelectFields.Add(gridGroupByField)

member.value: String representing the friendly name shown

member.remarks: Meaningful only for fields in the collection.
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how the data will be sorted. Acceptable values are the values of enumeration (Ascending, Descending and None).
member.value: Returns the sorting mode applied to the grouped data. By default it is Ascending.

Dim gridGroupByField As GridGroupByField
gridGroupByField = New GridGroupByField gridGroupByField.FieldName = "EmployeeID" gridGroupByField.SortOrder = GridSortOrder.Descending expression.GroupByFields.Add(gridGroupByField)

member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.exception: is not the same type as this instance.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes in the sort order. Copies the selected cells to the clipboard.
The cells whos content will be copied to the clipboard. The clipboard format. Wheather cells values should be cut. member.summary: Arranges the to its final location. The element must call the Arrange method of each of its children.
member.param: The size that is available for element.
member.remarks: In this method call to the Arrange method of each child must be made.
member.returns: The rectangle occupied by the element. Usually . Should you return different size, the Layout system will restart measuring and rearranging the items. That could lead to infinite recursion.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode
member.summary: Specifies how a user starts cell editing in the RadVirtualGrid control.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnEnter
member.summary: Editing begins when the cell receives focus. This mode is useful when pressing the TAB key to enter values across a row, or when pressing the ENTER key to enter values down a column.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnKeystroke
member.summary: Editing begins when any alphanumeric key is pressed while the cell has focus.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnKeystrokeOrF2
member.summary: Editing begins when any alphanumeric key or F2 is pressed while the cell has focus (default value).

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnF2
member.summary: Editing begins when F2 is pressed while the cell has focus. This mode places the selection point at the end of the cell contents.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridBeginEditMode.BeginEditProgrammatically
member.summary: Editing begins only when the RadVirtualGrid.BeginEdit() method is called.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridEnterKeyMode
member.summary: Specifies the behavior when the user presses Enter while editing a row.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridEnterKeyMode.None
member.summary: Pressing Enter key saves the value in the cell and the cell remains selected.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridEnterKeyMode.EnterMovesToNextCell
member.summary: Pressing Enter key saves the value in the cell moves focus to the next cell and opens its editor.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridEnterKeyMode.EnterMovesToNextRow
member.summary: Pressing Enter key saves the value in the cell moves focus to the next row and opens editor of the cell bellow current.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadVirtualGridElement.EndEdit

member.returns: Returns true if the operation is successful. Returns false if the operation is not successful e.g. validation fails or the grid was not in edit mode.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState
member.summary: Stores information about row sizes and provides methods for fast scrolling among millions of rows. The class only stores the sizes of rows which have been resized and uses additional structures to allow fast calculation of target state when scrolling with large amounts.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.itemSizes
member.summary: Keeps the sizes only of the resized items

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.partialItemSizes
member.summary: Keeps the partial sum of sizes up to a given item i.e. the scroll distance from the beginning to the bottom of the specified item. The key is the index of the item, the value is the sum of item sizes up to the bottom of that item. Has entries only for the resized items. Allows to quickly calculate the distance between two resized items. Keeps the entries sorted in an increasing order of items' indices (allows for quick lookup via binary search). Updated when the itemSizes dictionary changes.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.UpdateOnItemSizeChanged
member.summary: Updates the internal structures when the size of an item changes. Needed for proper calculations of scroll offsets. See the description of [partialItemSizes] and [itemSizes] for more info.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.GetTotalItemSize
member.summary: Calculates the total size of all items, using the ItemCount, DefaultItemSize, ItemSpacing, and considering the resized items. Used to calculate the maximum for the scrollbar.
member.returns: The total item size.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.GetScrollDownTarget(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates and returns the scroller position and offset if scrolled down from the bottom of item [startIndex] with [scrollOffset].
member.param: The current item from the scroller (the scroll operation starts from the bottom of this item).
Returns the index of the item which should be set as Current to the scroller.
member.returns: Return the new scroll offset which should be set to the scroller after the Current has been set.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.GetScrollUpTarget(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates and returns the scroller position and offset if scrolled up from the bottom of item [startIndex] with [scrollOffset].
member.param: The current item from the scroller (the scroll operation starts from the bottom of this item).
Returns the index of the item which should be set as Current to the scroller.
member.returns: Return the new scroll offset which should be set to the scroller after the Current has been set.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.FindNextResizedItem(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds a resized item with an index, larger than [startIndex]. Uses binary search to quickly lookup the index. If there are no resized items after [startIndex], returns -1.
member.param: The index after which resized items should be searched.
Returns the index of the found item in [partialItemSizes] for future use.
member.returns: Returns the index of the found resized item, or -1 if no such item is found after [startIndex].

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.FindPrevResizedItem(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds a resized item with an index, smaller than [startIndex]. Uses binary search to quickly lookup the index. If there are no resized items before [startIndex], returns -1.
member.param: The index before which resized items should be searched.
Returns the index of the found item in [partialItemSizes] for future use.
member.returns: Returns the index of the found resized item, or -1 if no such item is found after [startIndex].

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.FindNextResizedItemWithinRange(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the last resized item which is after [startIndexInArray] in the [partialItemSizes] list and also fits entirely into the scrollOffset. This means that, starting from the top of the item at [startIndexInArray], the distance to the found item's bottom should be less than or equal to the scrollOffset. After the method completes, the [startIndex] must be set to the found resized item's index, and the [scrollOffset] must be updated with the remainder as if we scrolled to the bottom of the found item.
member.param: The index of the start item in the [partialItemSizes].
The offset to scroll with. Should be updated when a new target item is found.
This variable should be updated with the index of the found item.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.VirtualGridTableViewState.FindPrevResizedItemWithinRange(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the first resized item which is before [startIndexInArray] in the [partialItemSizes] list and also fits entirely into the scrollOffset. This means that, starting from the top of the item at [startIndexInArray], the distance to the found item's top should be less than or equal to the scrollOffset. After the method completes, the [startIndex] must be set to the found resized item's index, and the [scrollOffset] must be updated with the remainder as if we scrolled to the top of the found item.
member.param: The index of the start item in the [partialItemSizes].
The offset to scroll with. Should be updated when a new target item is found.
This variable should be updated with the index of the found item.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadMultiColumnComboBoxElement
member.summary: Represents a multi column combo box element. The RadMultiColumnComboBox class is a simple wrapper for the RadMultiColumnComboBoxElement class. The RadMultiColumnComboBox acts to transfer events to and from its corresponding RadMultiColumnComboBoxElement instance. The RadMultiColumnComboBoxElement which is essentially the RadMultiColumnComboBox control may be nested in other telerik controls. The RadMultiColumnComboBoxElement class implements all logical and UI functionality.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadGridViewBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnEnter
member.summary: Editing begins when the cell receives focus. This mode is useful when pressing the TAB key to enter values across a row, or when pressing the ENTER key to enter values down a column.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadGridViewBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnKeystroke
member.summary: Editing begins when any alphanumeric key is pressed while the cell has focus.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadGridViewBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnKeystrokeOrF2
member.summary: Editing begins when any alphanumeric key or F2 is pressed while the cell has focus (default value).

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadGridViewBeginEditMode.BeginEditOnF2
member.summary: Editing begins when F2 is pressed while the cell has focus. This mode places the selection point at the end of the cell contents.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadGridViewBeginEditMode.BeginEditProgrammatically
member.summary: Editing begins only when the RadGridView.BeginEdit(System.Boolean) method is called.
